# QA Coordination Hub

## What This Is

A QA coordination system that transforms qa-tools into the human coordination layer for QA at BONKbot. Two modes: Pre-release QA (triggered by Linear view additions, responds in threads to Linear's native Slack messages) and Ceremony QA (deployment smoke tests). qa-tools is the source of truth; Slack is just a control surface.

## Core Value

**Visibility & tracking** - Everyone knows what's in queue, who's working what, and nothing falls through the cracks. If a ticket sits untouched, the system escalates. If someone claims it, everyone sees.

## Requirements

### Validated

(None yet — ship to validate)

### Active

**Core Infrastructure:**
- [ ] Data model for QATicket, TesterProfile, LinearMessage mapping
- [ ] Vercel KV store with schemas for all entities
- [ ] Event bus for surface notifications

**Pre-release QA (Linear → Slack threads):**
- [ ] Linear webhook handler for "QA:Mods" view-add events
- [ ] Slack listener to capture Linear's native messages
- [ ] Message-to-ticket ID mapping store
- [ ] Thread reply Block Kit messages with claim/pass/blocked buttons
- [ ] Assignment engine with smart scoring (expertise, workload, history, priority)
- [ ] Tester profile sync from Linear users
- [ ] Button action handlers (claim, pass, blocked)
- [ ] Slash commands (/qa-queue, /qa-claim, /qa-my-tickets, etc.)
- [ ] Escalation checker (24h, 48h stale warnings in threads)
- [ ] Morning routine summary post

**Ceremony QA (Deployment coordination):**
- [ ] Ceremony Tracker webhook receiver
- [ ] Session management for ceremony QA runs
- [ ] Checklist posting to ceremony channel
- [ ] Completion callback to Ceremony Tracker

**Documentation:**
- [ ] Automation opportunity docs for QA engineers (what they should build in Playwright)

### Out of Scope

- **Custom UI/dashboard** — Slack-only for v1, no separate web interface
- **Playwright integration** — QA engineers own automation separately; we document gaps
- **Metrics/analytics dashboards** — No tester performance reports or cycle time analytics in v1
- **Replace Linear's Slack app** — We reply in threads, don't replace the native integration
- **Automated test execution** — We coordinate humans, not run tests ourselves

## Context

**Existing codebase:** qa-tools currently has API smoke tests and manual runbooks. The smoke test infrastructure remains but is secondary to the coordination features.

**Related systems:**
- **Linear** — Source of QA tickets, uses "QA:Mods" view to trigger notifications
- **Linear's Slack app** — Posts native messages to #qa-mods channel when issues added to view
- **Ceremony Tracker** — Deployment coordination tool, will call qa-tools for QA steps
- **web-terminal-frontend-tests** — QA engineers' Playwright repo (separate, they own it)

**Current pain point:** When Linear posts to Slack, it's a free-for-all. Testers don't know who should take what, tickets sit unclaimed, and there's no visibility into queue health.

**Thread reply pattern:** QA bot finds Linear's native message by issue ID, replies in thread with assignment info and action buttons. Keeps context together, doesn't duplicate messages.

## Constraints

- **TypeScript** — Consistent with existing codebase
- **Vercel KV** — Storage layer (plan specifies this)
- **Linear View trigger** — Uses existing "QA:Mods" view pattern, not status changes
- **Slack as surface only** — qa-tools is source of truth, Slack is control surface

## Key Decisions

| Decision | Rationale | Outcome |
|----------|-----------|---------|
| Thread reply to Linear messages | Keeps context together, doesn't duplicate | — Pending |
| Vercel KV for storage | Serverless-friendly, matches deployment model | — Pending |
| Event bus for notifications | Decouples core from surfaces, enables future UI | — Pending |
| Smart assignment algorithm | Reduces manual coordination, fair distribution | — Pending |

# QA Coordination Hub - Stakeholder Briefing

<!--
  GSD ARTIFACT: BRIEFING.md (Experimental)

  PURPOSE: Stakeholder communication layer for GSD projects.
  Synthesizes PROJECT.md + ROADMAP.md + STATE.md into meeting-friendly format.

  TO UNWIND FROM GSD:
  1. This file can be deleted without affecting project execution
  2. No other GSD files depend on this artifact
  3. All source data lives in PROJECT.md, ROADMAP.md, STATE.md
  4. This is a presentation layer only - no authoritative data here

  MAINTENANCE: Regenerate before meetings using /gsd:briefing (if we build that)
  or manually update from source files.

  Created: 2026-01-13
  Pattern status: EXPERIMENTAL - evaluating for GSD core inclusion
-->

## The Problem We're Solving

<!--
  SECTION: Pain Point (for stakeholder empathy)
  Source: PROJECT.md "Current pain point" section
-->

**Current state:** When Linear posts QA tickets to Slack, it's a free-for-all.

- Testers don't know who should take what
- Tickets sit unclaimed with no visibility
- No way to see queue health at a glance
- Work falls through the cracks

**After this project:** Everyone knows what's in queue, who's working what, and nothing falls through the cracks.

---

## What You'll Get

<!--
  SECTION: Value Proposition (what stakeholders interact with)
  Source: PROJECT.md Requirements + ROADMAP.md Phase details

  Note: This section should be updated as phases complete.
  Currently reflects full vision, not just completed work.
-->

### Pre-Release QA Flow (Phases 1-6)

```
Linear "QA:Mods" view → qa-tools detects → Replies in Slack thread → Smart assignment → You claim/pass/blocked
```

**What you'll see in Slack:**
- Thread replies under Linear's native messages (no duplicate posts)
- Block Kit UI with **Claim**, **Pass**, **Blocked** buttons
- Assignment suggestions based on expertise, workload, history
- Escalation warnings if tickets go stale (24h, 48h)

**Commands you'll have:**
| Command | What it does |
|---------|--------------|
| `/qa-queue` | See all open tickets and their status |
| `/qa-claim [ticket]` | Claim a ticket for yourself |
| `/qa-my-tickets` | See what's on your plate |

### Ceremony QA Flow (Phase 7)

```
Deployment starts → Ceremony Tracker calls qa-tools → Checklist posted to channel → You complete checks → Callback to Ceremony Tracker
```

### Alert-Triggered QA (Phase 8)

```
Grafana alert fires → qa-tools receives webhook → Notifies appropriate tester → You investigate
```

---

## Roadmap

<!--
  SECTION: Visual Roadmap (Mermaid)
  Source: ROADMAP.md Phases section

  Update this diagram when phases complete or roadmap changes.
  Mermaid renders in GitHub, VS Code, and most markdown viewers.
-->

```mermaid
gantt
    title QA Coordination Hub Roadmap
    dateFormat  YYYY-MM-DD

    section Foundation
    Phase 1: Data & KV & Events    :done, p1, 2026-01-07, 1d

    section Linear Integration
    Phase 2: Webhooks & Sync       :done, p2, after p1, 1d

    section Slack Integration
    Phase 3: Listener & Threads    :active, p3, after p2, 2d
    Phase 4: Assignment Engine     :p4, after p3, 2d
    Phase 5: Commands & Actions    :p5, after p4, 2d
    Phase 6: Escalation & Routines :p6, after p5, 1d

    section Extended Features
    Phase 7: Ceremony QA           :p7, after p1, 3d
    Phase 8: Alert-triggered QA    :p8, after p1, 3d
```

### Phase Summary

<!--
  SECTION: Phase details table
  Source: ROADMAP.md Progress table + Phase Details
-->

| Phase | What It Delivers | Status |
|-------|------------------|--------|
| **1. Foundation** | Data model, storage, event system | Done |
| **2. Linear Integration** | Webhook handler, tester sync | Done |
| **3. Slack Listener & Threads** | Message capture, thread replies | **In Progress** |
| **4. Assignment Engine** | Smart tester matching algorithm | Next |
| **5. Commands & Actions** | Slash commands, button handlers | Planned |
| **6. Escalation & Routines** | Stale warnings, morning summary | Planned |
| **7. Ceremony QA** | Deployment coordination | Planned |
| **8. Alert-triggered QA** | Grafana integration | Planned |

---

## Current Progress

<!--
  SECTION: Progress snapshot
  Source: STATE.md Current Position + Performance Metrics
-->

**Overall:** 35% complete (7 of ~20 plans executed)

**Currently blocked on:** Manual Slack/Vercel configuration for Phase 3 completion

**Velocity:** Averaging 3 minutes per plan execution (very fast iteration)

```
Progress: ███░░░░░░░ 35%

Phase 1: ██████████ Complete
Phase 2: ██████████ Complete
Phase 3: ██████░░░░ 67% (2/3 plans)
Phase 4-8: ░░░░░░░░░░ Not started
```

---

## Discussion Points

<!--
  SECTION: Meeting discussion prompts
  Purpose: Gather stakeholder input, validate assumptions

  These should be customized before each meeting based on:
  - Current phase and upcoming decisions
  - Known unknowns in the project
  - Areas where stakeholder expertise is valuable
-->

### Validating Our Assumptions

1. **Thread replies vs. new messages** - We're replying in threads under Linear's native Slack messages. Does this match how you'd want to interact, or would separate messages be better?

2. **Assignment suggestions** - The system will suggest who should take a ticket based on expertise, workload, and history. Do you want:
   - Hard assignments (system assigns, you can reassign)?
   - Soft suggestions (system recommends, you claim)?
   - No suggestions (first-come-first-served with visibility)?

3. **Escalation timing** - Current plan is warnings at 24h and 48h for unclaimed tickets. Are these the right thresholds?

### Understanding Your Workflow

4. **Expertise areas** - What are the distinct expertise areas we should track? (e.g., frontend, API, payments, mobile, specific features)

5. **Workload visibility** - What's a healthy number of concurrent tickets for a tester? When should the system consider someone "overloaded"?

6. **Morning routine** - Would a daily summary post be useful? What time? What should it include?

### Ceremony QA Specifics

7. **Checklist format** - What does a deployment QA checklist look like today? Can you share an example?

8. **Completion criteria** - How do you signal "QA complete" for a deployment today?

### Future Ideas

9. **What else would make your life easier?** Open floor for pain points we haven't addressed.

---

## Decisions Needed

<!--
  SECTION: Explicit decisions requiring stakeholder input
  Purpose: Clear action items that need resolution

  Update after meeting with decisions made.
-->

| Decision | Options | Impact | Decided |
|----------|---------|--------|---------|
| Assignment model | Hard / Soft / None | Affects Phase 4 design | Pending |
| Escalation thresholds | 24h/48h or custom | Affects Phase 6 | Pending |
| Expertise categories | List TBD | Affects assignment scoring | Pending |
| Morning summary time | TBD | Affects Phase 6 | Pending |

---

## Next Steps

<!--
  SECTION: Action items
  Update after meeting with agreed next steps
-->

**Before next meeting:**
- [ ] Complete Phase 3 (Slack integration working end-to-end)
- [ ] Demo thread reply functionality
- [ ] Gather expertise categories from team

**Decisions to make:**
- [ ] Assignment model (hard/soft/none)
- [ ] Escalation timing
- [ ] Morning summary preferences

---

## Appendix: Technical Context

<!--
  SECTION: Technical details for reference
  Source: PROJECT.md Constraints + Context

  Keep brief - this is for context, not deep technical discussion
-->

**Stack:** TypeScript, Vercel Functions, Vercel KV, Slack Bolt SDK

- No way to see queue health at a glance
- Work falls through the cracks

**After this project:** Everyone knows what's in queue, who's working what, and nothing falls through the cracks.

<!--

### Pre-Release QA Flow (Phases 1-6)

```
Linear "QA:Mods" view → qa-tools detects → Replies in Slack thread → Smart assignment → You claim/pass/blocked
```

**What you'll see in Slack:**
- Thread replies under Linear's native messages (no duplicate posts)
- Block Kit UI with **Claim**, **Pass**, **Blocked** buttons
- Assignment suggestions based on expertise, workload, history
- Escalation warnings if tickets go stale (24h, 48h)

**Commands you'll have:**
| Command | What it does |
|---------|--------------|
| `/qa-queue` | See all open tickets and their status |
| `/qa-claim [ticket]` | Claim a ticket for yourself |
| `/qa-my-tickets` | See what's on your plate |

```
Deployment starts → Ceremony Tracker calls qa-tools → Checklist posted to channel → You complete checks → Callback to Ceremony Tracker
```

### Alert-Triggered QA (Phase 8)

```
Grafana alert fires → qa-tools receives webhook → Notifies appropriate tester → You investigate
```

   - Soft suggestions (system recommends, you claim)?
   - No suggestions (first-come-first-served with visibility)?

3. **Escalation timing** - Current plan is warnings at 24h and 48h for unclaimed tickets. Are these the right thresholds?
